property.description: Indicate to clients whether Timeline service is enabled or not. If enabled, the TimelineClient library used by end-users will post entities and events to the Timeline server.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.enabled

property.description: The setting that controls whether yarn system metrics is published on the timeline server or not by RM.
property.name: yarn.system-metrics-publisher.enabled

property.description: Indicate to clients whether to query generic application data from timeline history-service or not. If not enabled then application data is queried only from Resource Manager.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.generic-application-history.enabled
yarn.nodemanager.vmem-check-enabled
property.description: Whether virtual memory limits will be enforced for containers

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.vmem-pmem-ratio
property.description: Ratio between virtual memory to physical memory when setting memory limits for containers
Address for the Timeline server to start the RPC server.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.address

property.description: The http address of the Timeline service web application.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.webapp.address

property.description: The https address of the Timeline service web application.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.webapp.https.address

property.description: Handler thread count to serve the client RPC requests.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.handler-thread-count

property.description: Enables cross-origin support (CORS) for web services where cross-origin web response headers are needed. For example, javascript making a web services request to the timeline server.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.http-cross-origin.enabled

property.description: Comma separated list of origins that are allowed for web services needing cross-origin (CORS) support. Wildcards (*) and patterns allowed
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.http-cross-origin.allowed-origins

property.description: Comma separated list of methods that are allowed for web services needing cross-origin (CORS) support.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.http-cross-origin.allowed-methods

property.description: Comma separated list of headers that are allowed for web services needing cross-origin (CORS) support.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.http-cross-origin.allowed-headers

property.description: The number of seconds a pre-flighted request can be cached for web services needing cross-origin (CORS) support.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.http-cross-origin.max-age

property.description: Indicate to ResourceManager as well as clients whether history-service is enabled or not. If enabled, ResourceManager starts recording historical data that Timelien service can consume. Similarly, clients can redirect to the history service when applications finish if this is enabled.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.generic-application-history.enabled

property.description: Store class name for history store, defaulting to file system store
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.generic-application-history.store-class

property.description: Indicate to clients whether Timeline service is enabled or not. If enabled, the TimelineClient library used by end-users will post entities and events to the Timeline server.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.enabled

property.description: Store class name for timeline store.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.store-class

property.description: Enable age off of timeline store data.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.ttl-enable

property.description: Time to live for timeline store data in milliseconds.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.ttl-ms
